item.text: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a brave warrior. His mother was a prostitute, but Gilead was his father.

<st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> also <st data-num="03205" class="">gave</st><n id="1" /> him <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>. When his <st data-num="0802" class="">wife’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="01431" class="">grew up</st>, they <st data-num="01644" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03316" class="">Jephthah</st> <st data-num="01644" class="">leave</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “You are <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> going to <st data-num="05157" class="">inherit</st> any of our <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">wealth</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="0312" class="">another</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">woman’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.”
So Jephthah left his half brothers and lived in the land of Tob. Lawless men joined Jephthah’s gang and traveled with him.
It was some time after this when the Ammonites fought with Israel.

<st data-num="01961 0834">When</st> the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st> <st data-num="03898 05973 03478">attacked</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="02205" class="">leaders</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">asked</st> <st data-num="03316" class="">Jephthah</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">come back</st><n id="3" /> from the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="02897" class="">Tob</st>.

They <st data-num="0559 03316">said</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="01980" class="">Come</st>, <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> our <st data-num="07101" class="">commander</st>, so we can <st data-num="03898" class="">fight</st> with the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st>.”

<st data-num="03316" class="">Jephthah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to the <st data-num="02205" class="">leaders</st> of <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>, “<st data-num="03808" class="">But</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="08130" class="">hated</st> me and <st data-num="01644" class="">made</st> me <st data-num="01644" class="">leave</st><n id="1" /> my <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>. <st data-num="04069" class="">Why</st> do you <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">when</st> you are in <st data-num="06862" class="">trouble</st>?”

The <st data-num="02205" class="">leaders</st> of <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03316" class="">Jephthah</st>, “That may be <st data-num="03651" class="">true</st>,<n id="1" /> but <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st> we <st data-num="07725" class="">pledge</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you our <st data-num="07725" class="">loyalty</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01980" class="">Come</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> us and <st data-num="03898" class="">fight</st> with the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st>. Then you will <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">leader</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> who <st data-num="03427" class="">live</st> in <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>.”<n id="4" />
Jephthah said to the leaders of Gilead, “All right. If you take me back to fight with the Ammonites and the Lord gives them to me, I will be your leader.”
The leaders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “The Lord will judge any grievance you have against us if we do not do as you say.”
So Jephthah went with the leaders of Gilead. The people made him their leader and commander. Jephthah repeated the terms of the agreement before the Lord in Mizpah.
Jephthah sent messengers to the Ammonite king, saying, “Why have you come against me to attack my land?”

The Ammonite king said to Jephthah’s messengers, “Because Israel stole my land when they came up from Egypt—from the Arnon River in the south to the Jabbok River in the north, and as far west as the Jordan. Now return it peaceably!”
Jephthah sent messengers back to the Ammonite king

and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> <st data-num="03316" class="">Jephthah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st>, ‘<st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">steal</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> and the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st>.

<st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> they <st data-num="05927" class="">left</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">traveled</st><n id="2" /> through the <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> the <st data-num="05488" class="">Red</st> <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st> and then <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="06946" class="">Kadesh</st>.

<st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="04397" class="">messengers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st>, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> allow us<n id="1" /> to <st data-num="05674" class="">pass through</st> your <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.” But the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">rejected</st> the <st data-num="08085" class="">request</st>.<n id="2" /> Israel <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">the same request</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>, but he was <st data-num="03808 014">unwilling</st> to cooperate.<n id="3" /> So <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">stayed</st> at <st data-num="06946" class="">Kadesh</st>.

Then Israel<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01980" class="">went through</st> the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> and <st data-num="05437" class="">bypassed</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st> and the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>. They <st data-num="0935" class="">traveled</st> <st data-num="04217 08121">east</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> and <st data-num="02583" class="">camped</st> on the <st data-num="05676" class="">other side</st> of the <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st> River;<n id="2" /> they did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st> through <st data-num="04124" class="">Moabite</st> <st data-num="01366" class="">territory</st> (the <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st> was <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab’s</st> <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st>).

<st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="04397" class="">messengers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05511" class="">Sihon</st>, the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorite</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> who ruled in <st data-num="02809" class="">Heshbon</st>, and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> allow us to <st data-num="05674" class="">pass through</st> your <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> our <st data-num="04725" class="">land</st>.”<n id="1" />

But <st data-num="05511" class="">Sihon</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0539" class="">trust</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> to <st data-num="05674" class="">pass through</st> his <st data-num="01366" class="">territory</st>. <st data-num="05511" class="">He</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0622" class="">assembled</st> his <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="02583" class="">camped</st> in <st data-num="03096" class="">Jahaz</st>, and <st data-num="03898" class="">fought</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.
The Lord God of Israel handed Sihon and his whole army over to Israel, and they defeated them. Israel took all the land of the Amorites who lived in that land.

They <st data-num="03423" class="">took</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorite</st> <st data-num="01366" class="">territory</st> from the <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st> River on the south <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="02999" class="">Jabbok</st> River on the north, <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st> in the east <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st> in the west.<n id="1" />
Since the Lord God of Israel has driven out the Amorites before his people Israel, do you think you can just take it from them?
You have the right to take what Chemosh your god gives you, but we will take the land of all whom the Lord our God has driven out before us.

<st data-num="02896" class="">Are</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="06258" class="">really</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">better</st> than <st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06834" class="">Zippor</st>, <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>? Did he <st data-num="07378" class="">dare to</st> <st data-num="07378" class="">quarrel</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>? <st data-num="0518" class="">Did</st> he <st data-num="03898" class="">dare to</st> <st data-num="03898" class="">fight</st> with them?<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> has been <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st> in <st data-num="02809" class="">Heshbon</st> and its <st data-num="01323" class="">nearby towns</st>, in <st data-num="06177" class="">Aroer</st> and its <st data-num="01323" class="">nearby towns</st>, and in <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05892 0834">cities</st> <st data-num="05921 03027">along</st> the <st data-num="0769" class="">Arnon</st> for <st data-num="07969 03967" class="">300</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>! <st data-num="04069" class="">Why</st> did you <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05337" class="">reclaim</st> them during <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">time</st>?
I have not done you wrong, but you are doing wrong by attacking me. May the Lord, the Judge, judge this day between the Israelites and the Ammonites!’”
But the Ammonite king disregarded the message sent by Jephthah.
The Lord’s Spirit empowered Jephthah. He passed through Gilead and Manasseh and went to Mizpah in Gilead. From there he approached the Ammonites.
Jephthah made a vow to the Lord, saying, “If you really do hand the Ammonites over to me,
then whoever is the first to come through the doors of my house to meet me when I return safely from fighting the Ammonites—he will belong to the Lord, and I will offer him up as a burnt sacrifice.”
Jephthah approached the Ammonites to fight with them, and the Lord handed them over to him.
He defeated them from Aroer all the way to Minnith—20 cities in all, even as far as Abel Keramim. He wiped them out! The Israelites humiliated the Ammonites.
When Jephthah came home to Mizpah, there was his daughter hurrying out to meet him, dancing to the rhythm of tambourines. She was his only child; except for her he had no son or daughter.
When he saw her, he ripped his clothes and said, “Oh no! My daughter! You have completely ruined me! You have brought me disaster! I made an oath to the Lord, and I cannot break it.”
She said to him, “My father, since you made an oath to the Lord, do to me as you promised. After all, the Lord vindicated you before your enemies, the Ammonites.”

She then <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her <st data-num="01" class="">father</st>, “Please <st data-num="06213" class="">grant</st> me <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> one <st data-num="01697" class="">wish</st>.<n id="1" /> For <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">months</st> <st data-num="07503 04480">allow</st> me to <st data-num="01980 03381">walk</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="02022" class="">hills</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">with</st> my <st data-num="07474" class="">friends</st> and <st data-num="01058 05921">mourn</st> my <st data-num="01331" class="">virginity</st>.”<n id="2" />

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “You may <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st>.” He <st data-num="07971" class="">permitted</st> her <st data-num="07971" class="">to leave</st><n id="1" /> for <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">months</st>. She <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">with</st> her <st data-num="07464" class="">friends</st> and <st data-num="01058 05921">mourned</st> her <st data-num="01331" class="">virginity</st> as she walked <st data-num="05921" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="02022" class="">hills</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01961 07093">After</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">months</st> she <st data-num="07725" class="">returned</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her <st data-num="01" class="">father</st>, and he <st data-num="06213" class="">did</st> to her <st data-num="05088 0834">as</st> he had <st data-num="05087" class="">vowed</st>. <st data-num="01931" class="">She</st> died a <st data-num="03808 03045 0376">virgin</st>.<n id="1" /> Her tragic death <st data-num="01961" class="">gave rise to</st> a <st data-num="02706" class="">custom</st> in <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.<n id="2" />
Every year Israelite women commemorate the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite for four days.
